intro: Aporum mindanaense, commonly known as the Mindanao aporum, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes plants like peace lilies and calla lilies. The plant features a tall, erect stem with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Its flowers are clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Aporum mindanaense is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
